sequence_generation Package¶

orthogonal_sequences Module¶

Generates a set of orthogonal DNA sequences for a given protein sequence Currently limited by the size of the protein sequence - ~10 residues max To increase size, need to optimize search method and take steps to reduce memory usage (write to files and iterate/queue)

class pymbt.sequence_generation.orthogonal_sequences.OrthoSeq(prot_seq, oligo_n, candidates=0, temp=50, min_score=0.95, n_attempt=100000.0)[source]¶

Class to calculate, store, and write orthogonality-optimized peptide sequences.

Parameters:
  • prot_seq (str) – Input protein sequence.
  • oligo_n (int) – The final number of orthogonal sequences to output.
  • candidates (int) – The number of new sequences to try out on each iteration.
  • temp (float) – Temperature at which to evaluate for orthogonality.
  • min_score (float) – Score setpoint - stop optimization once this score has been reched.
  • n_attempt – Attempt timeout - sets maximum number of times to attempt optimization without seeing an improvement in score
log(loop_count, n_attempted, score_mean, score_min, met, timer, oligo_list)[source]¶

Provides data trail and allows resuming/passing along an extended attempt.

Parameters:
  • loop_count (int) – Current loop number.
  • n_attempted (int) – Number of times optimization has been consecutively attempted without improving the score.
  • score_mean (float) – Mean of the unboundedness score.
  • score_min (float) – Min of the unboundedness score.
  • met (int) – Number of oligos that have met the score threshold.
  • timer (float) – Length of time for the calculation so far in seconds.
  • oligo_list (list) – List of the current best oligos.
start(resume=False, wholemat=False, report=True, weighted=True, freq_threshold=0.5, oligo_conc=5e-07)[source]¶

Start the optimization.

Parameters:
  • resume (str) – A path to a dir from a previous run, and will cause start() to pick up where it left off.
  • wholemat (bool) – if True, m worst oligos are thrown out on each iteration. if False, single best is kept. There is a difference but it should be better documented.
  • weighted (bool) – Determines whether codons generated should be weighted (codon-optimized).
  • freq_threshold (float) – relative frequency threshold below which codons should not be used. Enables avoidance of very rare codons (codon optimization).
pymbt.sequence_generation.orthogonal_sequences.remove_redundant(seq_list, oligo_params)[source]¶

Removes and regenerates sequences that appear more than once in a list.

Parameters:
  • seq_list (str) – Sequences.
  • oligo_params (tuple) – parameters to be passed to _gen_oligo.
pymbt.sequence_generation.orthogonal_sequences.unflatten(input_list, size)[source]¶

Given a flat list, makes a new list of ‘size’-length lists out of it, in order.

Parameters:
  • input_list (list) – List to flatten.
  • size (int) – Group size.

random_bases Module¶

Generate random DNA or RNA sequences.

class pymbt.sequence_generation.random_bases.RandomBases(size)[source]¶

Generate random DNA or RNA sequences.

Parameters:size (int) – Output sequence length.
generate()[source]¶

Generate the sequence.

random_codons Module¶

Generate random codons.

class pymbt.sequence_generation.random_codons.RandomCodons(sequence, material='pep', freq_table='sc', threshold=0.0)[source]¶

Generator class for random DNA or RNA sequence.

Parameters:
  • sequence (str) – Sequence for which to generate randomized codons.
  • material (str) – ‘dna’ for DNA or ‘pep’ for amino acid sequence.
  • freq_table (dict) – Codon frequency table to use.
  • threshold (float between 0 and 1) – relative threshold cutoff for codon frequencies.
generate()[source]¶

Generate the sequence.

weighted_codons Module¶

Generate random, but usage frequency-weighted codons (i.e. codon optimization).

class pymbt.sequence_generation.weighted_codons.WeightedCodons(sequence, frequency_table='sc', material='pep')[source]¶

Provides a generator class for random, weighted DNA or RNA sequences.

Parameters:
  • sequence (str) – Input sequence.
  • frequency_table (dict) – The codon frequency dictionary to use.
  • material (str) – ‘dna’ for DNA or ‘pep’ for amino acid sequence (default).
generate()[source]¶

Generate the sequence.

weighted(pep)[source]¶

Take an amino acid, select a codon at random, weighted by frequency.

Parameters:pep (str) – Peptide sequence.
